channel.title: Code Cleaner xo!

item.title: Code Cleaner xo!
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:6, topic:536570”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=655382.msg4388056#msg4388056 date=1386440800]
I’d probably throw all the exp’s into an array, then iterate through the array backwards so that you get the highest qualified item first instead of going through all of the conditions it’d be true for.
[/quote]This is very architecture-specific…[/quote]I figured he didn’t really have a rhyme or reason to his distribution of exp lol

Read full topic

item.title: Code Cleaner xo!
item.dc:creator: @Frantix Frantix
item.description:
@Frantix wrote:

[quote=“sspoke, post:2, topic:536570”]use
http://jsbeautifier.org/

and use arrays for all xp’s

or instead of doing if’s like that looks into

if(stuff) { attack++; } else if(stuff) { attack++; } else if(more stuff) { attack++; [/quote]
I put the xp into arrays it’s very long don’t worry about that. If I do it the else if way the branches are longer.

item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

You could probably use a single expression to do this instead of having all of those branches? I haven’t played RS in a long time so can’t write any exact code, but something like this - http://rsdo.net/rsdonline/guides/Experience%20formula.html

item.title: Code Cleaner xo!
item.dc:creator: @Frantix Frantix
item.description:
@Frantix wrote:

I am making a basic leveling up system for my javascript project.

How could I make this look cleaner im still a beginner xo
because I want to go all the way to 99 maybe more i haven’t decided.

function myFunction() {
    attackxp += 1000;
    strengthxp += 1000; {
        if (strengthxp >= 3500 || attackxp >= 3500) {
            strength = +1;
            attack = +1;
        }
        if (strengthxp >= 7000 || attackxp >= 7000) {
            strength++;
            attack++;
            if (strengthxp >= 10500 || attackxp >= 10500) {
                strength++;
                attack++;
            }
            if (strengthxp >= 14000 || attackxp >= 14000) {
                strength++;
                attack++;
            }
            if (strengthxp >= 17500 || attackxp >= 17500) {
                strength++;
                attack++;
            }
            if (strengthxp >= 21000 || attackxp >= 21000) {
                strength++;
                attack++;
            }
        }
    }
}

Read full topic
